ratings.comment: Do not take his class if you value your sanity or your GPA

I think Adil does his best given how difficult the topics are in the first place. He cares deeply about his students if they are willing to give him the chance and took the time past office hours to help me fix an error. He made an announcement today wishing all of us well and thanking us for the semester despite all the hate he received on piazza.

Adil is a soft-spoken man, quite even-keeled. But, while his patience may be inexhaustible, ours is not. Adils cryptic lecture slides and his propensity for accidentally teaching incorrect facts during lecture made learning very challenging. Highly recommend the 2019 edition of Introduction to Computing Systems - youll need it.

Adil is nice but I've never seen a class that was less useful. You won't learn anything and your grade will depend on how much you know going into it. Because I could already do basic binary arithmetic I got an easy A in the class and someone who I know who works a hundred times harder than me probably won't because she didn't.

Adil struggles to explain most things on his slides during lectures. I have looked for information in the lessons online and find almost exact or similar slides from other universities leading me to believe he just uses the same slide layouts and images as other professors. Extremely dry slides and very hard to stay attentive.

Poor Adil, you really want to like the guy, but the class is so complicated that even when he tries - which is rarely - the information just goes way over everyone's heads. He's a nice guy, but the information given on piazza and canvas contradict each other, most homework questions aren't answered in lecture, and the discussion sessions are jokes.
Lectures are pretty much useless. Be prepared to teach yourself almost everything.
Useless lectures and the slides are also a mass, not well-organized. I would never take the course if it is not a required course in my degree plan.

While I do admit that his lectures are not very helpful, I would actually recommend him now. He gave us extensions on most of the hws (there are 8 and take about 2-4 hours to complete). He curved exam 3 by a lot and decided to drop 2 hws instead of 1. Gave points back on exam 2. Do past exams and discussion packet!!! Average GPA was 3.5!!

Actually, I like him. Although his class may be not interesting, but if you listened carefully, you will learn something important. Whats more, you can choose not to lectures too, I seldom go there at last few weeks. But dont worry, you can learn everything useful through slides, homework and past exams. he curved the grades to help us get high.

I'm not really sure why people are so tough on Adil. He's not a great lecturer, but he posts lecture slides and the homework was pretty similar to the exams. The first two exam averages were around 87 and he curved the third one to there too. I've had miserable experiences at UW and his class definitely wasn't one of them.

Adil is not a good lecturer. However, he is quite caring and responsive when it comes to student complaints and grading. He will drop questions on the exams and also drops homeworks/extends deadlines based on the difficulty students are having with the material. People are too harsh to him on here, he's really not that bad.

Where do I start. Lecture is practically pointless as he doesn't explain any of the topics in depth. The class is so poorly setup that there's constant confusion about what's on exams/the extent of the content we need to know. If you're a CS major, just grind through the class, cause the chances you use any of this information is zero to none.
horrible professor, can barely teach and gives extremely difficult exams and homework

A lot of people being very harsh on Adil. His lectures are pretty boring. He's a great person and shows that he wants students to learn and be excited for the class, but I will admit he's not great at doing so. Overall the class is pretty easy and between the textbook and his lecture slides, you should be able to learn everything.
DON'T TAKE IT. JUST DONT

Absolute wreck of a class. I actually tried paying attention but no use. Pathetic teacher and very very boring lectures. Lecture are all over the place and going to class is useless. Exams are tough and studying for them by yourself makes it even more tough. DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS. YOU WILL REGRET IT THROUGHOUT THE SEMESTER!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Try to take this class with anyone but Adil. Lectures are not useful and most people end up having to teach themselves everything using the textbook/online resources. Communication between Adil and the TAs and students is abysmal.
Professor is a good person. But maybe he is not suit for teaching,.

We had a very difficult midterm just because people did well on the first two exams. The exam was designed in a way that nearly no one would finish it. The curve doesn't help at all. I got about 95% before the exam but now I could only hope that I will get an AB. I don't think it is fair to be punished by that exam.

This class is just bad. I wasn't going to give a rating, but I was going through an old exam to study and I could figure out why my answer didn't match the key. I looked online for help. Turns out the key, that was provided by the school, was wrong... Avoid taking this class if you possibly can.

This was probably one of the worst classes I have ever taken. For one of the midterms Adil upped the difficulty to the point where maybe 2 people finished in a lecture of 200 people because the first two exams were "too easy". The curve he applied to the exam afterwards made the average a 69%. This exam was definitely designed to lower grades.

Adil is the GOAT!! He's super energetic and even if he is sometimes all over the place, he gives you every tool you need to pass his class. Put in some effort, go over homework, and do practice exams, and the midterms are not that hard. Lectures are pretty much mandatory, but very engaging. TAKE 252 WITH ADIL, YOU WON'T REGRET IT!

One of the worst classroom experiences anyone can sign up for. Adil's lectures have next to zero tangible value, the exams and homework are extremely inconsistent in their difficulty and workload, and there is never communication with the students to tell them what to expect. This class is made difficult by virtue of poor instruction, not content.

Seems like a nice guy, but just isn't a great lecturer. Most people just stop going to class. Even the TA's didn't always approve of how he taught the class. He wouldn't even put in class slides online. Not everyone is a great lecturer even if they are a smart guy.

He seems like a nice guy but I really dont understand anything that he teaches. Probably because I dont like his teaching style. However, I shouldnt be judging his teaching style because my roommate is a big fan of him. Apart from that, theres a tonne of homework and the only good thing about it is the deadlines are often extended.
Nice guy I guess but does that matter when it comes to teaching? Terrible teacher.
the contents are a little bit too heacy but Adil is a good teacher. He can explain things really well.
He is a nice guy and a good teacher. Even though his teaching pace is fast, it is not his fault. He is reachable after class and patient to answer questions.

Adil is a nice guy. He wants all of his students to succeed and willingly extends homework deadlines. However, he is a terrible lecturer due to his thick foreign accent and volume at which he speaks. Furthermore, his explanations never fail to overcomplicate important concepts. I hope he can read this and change his lecture style.

Adil is a really nice guy and works hard at his job. He seemed to struggle to convey and explain the information in the class. Great guy but lectures can be difficult to follow - by the end of the semester roughly 80% of the class would skip lectures and try to learn the material on their own.

I think Adil is a better professor than many others seem to. He isn't extremely engaging and doesn't offer the best explanations, but he is usually pretty clear in lecture and often does offer problems / examples that illuminate the details / intricacies of the topic at hand. I did typically do worse on tests than I expected to.
He is amazing professor

Adil has an terrible reputation as a lecturer throughout the CS circle, and it is very much justified. Thankfully, the choice of TAs for this semester is excellent, without them honestly I would screwed. I prefer paying tuition to the TAs and learning from them full time rather than wasting it on Adil. To future students be prepared to self learn

Very uninteresting lectures with little to no explanation. I wouldn't have done well in this class if it weren't for YouTube tutorials and TA office hours. Extremely disappointed considering this class is a prerequisite for the CS major and I had to learn it all on my own.

If professors were as likely to receive academic integrity violations as students, Adil would receive many. He plagerizes his homeworks from previous professors homework and exams. His lecture notes are just stolen. He puts no effort into teaching this course, and he is not very transparent about grading
Worst lecturer ever

Enrollment for this class shot up every since the CS DEPARTMENT forced the class as a prequisite for CS majors. There are easily 300-400 students enrolled during a full semester. A lecturer as incompetent as Adil SHOULD NOT be allowed to be the sole instructor for such a huge class. At least let CS majors enroll in the better ECE 252 version

Come on UW, you can do so much better than this. It's unacceptable to force this course as a prerequisite and then provide this level of quality of instruction. If the CS department is honestly going to start to force prerequisites, the least they can do is get AT LEAST DECENT instructors.
Unbearably uninteresting lectures. If you can manage to pay attention, you still won't be able to understand what is being talked about.
Simply put, nice guy but horrible, horrible teacher

I wanted to be optimistic, unfortunately most of the reviews here are right. Adil is a decent guy, but he ABSOLUTELY cannot teach and the class was a complete trainwreck. This class was a waste of tuition, as I had to learn everything by myself. Take it with the engineering department if you can.

He has good intentions, but is utterly terrible at teaching. You are much better off skipping lectures and going to TA office hours each week instead. Also, it helps to look online for past exams and homeworks because they tend to be very similar.

Was the only ECE 252 prof available to CS majors in spring 2017. Saw his poor rate my professor score from his previous school, unfortunately accurate. He is a generally nice person, but his slides and teaching style are unhelpful. Half the class regularly skipped lecture and instead elected to go to mini-lectures provided to us by the Grad TAs.

Adil is a nice man, but his teaching style is quite boring and unhelpful. It's usually easier to go into one of the TA's office hours and get help from them, because his explanations are usually quite confusing. Also, exams are 70% of the grade, but there is no cumulative final.

Professor Ibrahim is a very nice person,he would be happy to help you to solve any problem you have, but he doesn't know how to teach. his accent and volume makes people sleep. He does have some health problem and cancel some lectures each semesters. the exams were not really hard, he would give you past exams for pre-exam study.
He is not the professor you want for this class. He is a nice person but not good at teaching. His monotone will make you sleep and distracted.
Not a very good lecturer at all. The class was very poorly organized, sometimes getting cancelled 5 minutes before lecture starts. Avoid if you can
Difficult to understand with his method of teaching. Midterms are poorly made.
I went to every lecture he provided. nothing learned from him

Adil seemed like a really nice guy... but he is by far the worst lecturer I've had at UW. Thankfully, the exams from previous years that are posted online are very similar to the actual exams. This class would have been a complete trainwreck otherwise. Take the class with a different professor if you can.

I only went to a few lectures. The general sense I got is that he really wants students to succeed... he just doesn't have the ability to teach or effectively run a class. I basically taught myself out of the textbook and slides. Luckily the material isn't super hard and the exams were similar to old ones posted.

This guy was literally the worst professor I have ever had. His lectures are basically him telling you what's in the book without and depth or pacing. Students had to tell him to turn up his mic literally every single class and he was often late. The things he says in class resemble nothing of whats on the hw, and as a result, the hw takes hours.
